56BD7BA1CBA14D7CAC6F76E8B552871B.description: Establish and follow standard wiring colour conventions (e.g., red is positive, black is negative, white or yellow is signal and green is ground) when using breadboards.

56B9A8B6EFFE4F48BA2202690D0B96C2.description: Demonstrate effective layout of components and connections on a breadboard to facilitate debugging and modification of circuits.

7402745AA7A24A0C912BC9D7F9B28BBE.description: Demonstrate the proper way of installing a variety of components (e.g., integrated circuits, button switches, wires and resistors) onto a breadboard.

185C0F7587CE42D9921E3CA1053E575D.description: Develop and follow a test strategy for debugging each sub circuit.

54DD8E7399B84C64971F3978158764D1.description: Organize electrical and electronic components and make all connections in a neat and tidy manner

58A2EBCED3964CC18644DAABF84ADCBD.description: Follow a standard colour convection (e.g., white is signal, negative is black and red is positive) when assigning wires for different purposes.

6403CECA290E49898AF05FEB61463E56.description: Incorporate appropriate strategies and conventions for debugging circuits.

854840118631462B95E654A03A16A8F9.description: Identify safe current and/or voltage values pertaining to personal safety.

5646ED9D0E604E92AF48406EFDA57776.description: Demonstrate safe practices when working with electricity and electrical devices.

4C8D120C7D1D48009AFF888E2269B86D.description: Apply engineering design processes to improve simple tasks and projects.

64FEBA1162894D68949606242A2DF051.description: Complete an assessment of all safety and robotics equipment and, in consultation with the instructor, perform maintenance to repair or replace defective or worn parts.

E117FC5ACAF8426D955721CCBE22DBF1.description: Practice good housekeeping and avoid obvious hazards (e.g., touching live wires, extending cords over walking spaces and leaving objects on the floor).
